intro: Opophytum australe, commonly known as the Australian flame vine, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange-red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Opophytum australe is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
